item.title: Data Profiling
item.description: When I’m starting a new project, I typically have no idea what is present in a data set, and I don’t know enough about the project to formulate reasonable questions for the keepers of the data. So I’m usually running an identical set of processes on every new data set I come across. I’ve discovered the DataExplorer package for R recently, which aims to assist in this process of shining a light into the cavern of unknown data.

item.title: Data Science Resources
item.description: I’ve been using R since 2013. In those days, R information was hard to come by. Information and best practices that did exist were kept under heavy guard. Most requests for help online were met with gate-keeping responses such as, “Did you read the help file?” or the classic, “Hey, I have a question”, followed by, “Never mind, I solved it - please delete”.

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Kevin Putschko. I’m a consulting data scientist with Experis in Kalamazoo, MI. I’m proficient in R and all things tidyverse. Find Me Online GitHub Twitter LinkedIn StackOverflow Contact Me kevin.putschko@experis.com

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: Stay tuned! This is the first post of my blog! Here I will discuss my adventures into the world of Data Science and R.
